title: Global cost of living and rising prices - S1

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Big AI news today!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: The Tech Policy Institute just announced a new regulation framework for large AI models.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: What does that mean?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: If you're using a model with over 1 billion parameters—think ChatGPT size—you need transparency measures and safety audits.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: When?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Q2 2026. So 18 months to comply.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: How's the industry reacting?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Actually pretty positive. Most companies were already doing this voluntarily, so it's just making it official.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: But smaller startups are worried about costs.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: True. Safety audits aren't cheap. Could be a barrier for new entrants.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: What should users expect?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: More transparency about AI capabilities and limitations. You'll know when you're talking to AI versus a human.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: That's good. More clarity is always better.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Exactly. This is about building trust while keeping innovation going.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Stay tuned for more on this story! [WORD_COUNT=180]

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.text: Let's dive even deeper into this topic, because there's so much more to explore here.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.text: Absolutely. We've covered the basics, but the implications and details are really worth examining more closely.
